content.title: BSR Scheme
content.beneficiary: Meritorious students pursuing PhD in Sciences
content.details: The Research Fellowship in Sciences for meritorious students BSR scheme of the UGC is open to candidates who are selected for registering for the Ph.D. program of the university through a procedure outlined already in the UGC notification by a regular admission procedure. The registration for Ph.D. may follow after the admissions.
benefits: JRF @ 24,800/-pm for 2 years; SRF@ Rs. 27,900 pm for the remaining period for GATE/NET Qualified candidates
JRF @ Rs. 21,700/- for 2 years; SRF @ Rs. 24,800/- pm for the remaining period for others
Contingency @ Rs. 12,000/- pa for JRF; @ Rs. 25,000/- pa for SRF
HRA as per categorization of cities by the Govt. of India
Medical facilities available in the University/Institution/College
Leave for a maximum period of 30 days in a year
eligibility: Candidates selected for registering to the Ph.D. program of the university through a procedure outlined in the UGC notification
Universities with Potential for Excellence/Centres with Potential for Excellence/Centres of Advance Studies and Department of Special Assistance identified by UGC
content.application_process: Online application for Research fellowships at the identified Universities/Institutions. Selections made by the concerned institution as per the provisions contained in the guidelines.
documents_required: Continuation certificate (to be submitted at the end of every three months)
Yearly Progress Report (to be submitted after completion of one year of the fellowship)
